name: Courtney Holloway
text: Bass Homes is a joke. Have you ever felt scammed? If you enjoyed that feeling then I would go see Bass Homes. These people are crooks, each and every one of them. We planned to build with them starting next year. We put a $3,000 deposit down. We sold our home and moved into a camper. We had to back out of our plans because of issues with financing our land. Jim told us REPEATEDLY that we would receive our down payment back. We continued to call and message and we were ignored. Here we are, two months later, a week before Christmas, and Bill Bass decides to refund $2,000 and keep a grand for himself. He says that they already paid an architect to draw up plans, but he knows and I know that this is a lie. Merry Christmas to you and your family Bill Bass. DO NOT TRUST THIS COMPANY.

As a woodworker and a person that has built two other homes, I can attest to the quatlity of the workmenship.  Jeremiah and Robert were excellent at their tasks and were a pleasure to work with.
The project was finshed on time and on budget.

text:
I recently purchased a Holland Homes, LLC home and I absolutely love it!
I've worked with many new home builders throughout the years and I can honestly say the Holland Homes build was a great experience! The best actually!

Working with Lana McCurdy from start of contract, throughout build process to final closing was a wonderful process experience. She is an absolute professional! I highly recommend!

Praises go to Lauren, interior designer and Alex, construction manager, too. They were both very responsive and took great interest in making my new home beautiful.

Overall, I highly recommend Holland Homes, LLC. They constructed a quality beautiful home for my family to make great memories for years to come!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, James! We loved working with you and are so happy with how your home turned out!

name: Michael Hamer
text:
My wife and I had been in love with their homes for several years and then finally had the chance to build with them. Their friendliness, responsiveness, and professionalism was beyond what I could have imagined. The ability to customize the home and the “selection” meeting offered more options than I could have ever hoped for, which allowed us to truly make our home “ours.”

Our project manager, Mitchell Beers kept us regularly updated- both via scheduled weekly online updates through the homeowner portal and extra updates during the week via text message when a major event happened. He was responsive to any question, issue, concern etc as it arose, and truly made the process fun.

The quality of the finished product was outstanding and their commitment to delivering and standing by a home that you can be proud of was impressive.

I hope we never need another house because we love ours so much, but if we do, Holland Homes will be the first people I call. Can not recommend enough.

resp.text: Michael, thanks for leaving us such a great review! We are so glad you enjoyed the Holland Homes experience as much as we enjoyed working with you. Mitchell is such an incredible project leader! We put customer experience and satisfaction as our priority, and your review reaffirms the hard work we put in every day. Thanks again! We are here for all your present and future homebuilding needs!

name: Clay Messer
text: Daniel Holland and Robert Melvin with Holland Homes were great!  They built our first house while we were in a time crunch before our first child was born.  We weren't sure if we would put roots down in the Auburn area for long so we decided to buy a starter home.  Our thought was to purchase a quality starter home from a quality builder so that in a year or two if we decided to sell, we would be able to sell the home with very little problem.  Well, we currently have our house under contract to be sold at a price well above what we payed.  We listed our house FSBO (so it was never actually "listed" on MLS) and it was under contract within 1 week.  I know we made a good decision choosing to buy a Holland Home.  Because we were so pleased with Daniel and Robert, we have already signed a contract for Holland Homes to build our "forever" home just as soon as we close on our first one.  I couldn't be more pleased with my experience with Daniel, Robert, and all the folks at Holland Homes.

resp.text: Clay, thanks for leaving us such a great review! We are so glad you enjoyed the Holland Homes experience as much as we enjoy working with you, still today! We put customer experience and satisfaction as our priority, and your review reaffirms the hard work we put in every day. Whether remodel, repair, addition, new build, or a sale, our goal is and always has been to help you make your house that feels like home. Daniel and Robert are incredible!  We hope you continue to enjoy your home for many more years to come! Thanks again!

name: Kustom Event
text:
Update from May....still not done... when after calling carports and warranty management multiple times.

My warranty request still hasn't been completed since January. Do not buy from this company. They have built over 25 homes since I put in this request and still haven't finished my warranty request. I hate this company. They have no morals or value. I've lost so much money taking off work and they no show without calling. I've paid people to house sit for repairs and they no show because the warranty department dropped the ball and didn't pay invoices. The invoice I signed was only alot $1,200. This is a billion dollar company. How hard is that to pay. And they still can't come back to complete it. They dont return emails. I emailed Friday.....still nothing. 2 weeks of my home looking like trash....still nothing. Ridiculous!

text: Poor quality work. Sheet rock wall start cracking not even a year after the house was built.

name: Jeffery Runyon
text: DO NOT BUY A HOUSE FROM THIS COMPANY. PIPES KEEP BURSTING IN MY HOUSE AND THEY DO NOT STAND BY THEIR WARRANTY

name: David Alvarez
text:
July 2020 update:
I had to pay over $3,000, out of pocket, for something the builder clearly did wrong and would not take ownership of.

I bought a property in Chelsea Station, back in May of 2018, that was built in 2014. I noticed that the builder placed the exit drainage pipe right into my backyard and it floods it all.

The lack of proper draining has also caused erosion by mine and my neighbor's fence. I contacted the warranty department and was told it's "an exclusion of warranty" and to find a landscape service that would make a "repair or modification" to my liking.

There's no ownership to their poorly built drainage setup, there are woods close by and even a city drainage they could have placed the exit drainage pipe at.

name: brad allen
text: Along with terrible customer service in the warranty department, which took almost 2 years for them to fix.  We all know they use the cheapest contractors.  So definitely not getting the best quality of work.  Doing some remodeling, check out the picture, you got to love their definition of insulating an exterior wall

name: TARSHA WILLIAMS
text: Poorly built home! I've had unlimited amount of underground water leaks and pipes bursting inside my walls.  D R HORTON refused to fix. I had to file water claims with my homeowners insurance due to the excessive amount of water damage.   My house is less than 10 years old. I will never purchase another D R HORTON home. I've contacted management onsite and management in office. It still has not been completed.  This is my first home and I've been lied to from the beginning. I come from a poor neighborhood and was attempting to give my family a beautiful home. Instead this has been a horrid experience.  I stay in Timberline. This is supposedly one of the best community's established. Instead from January until now I've see 25 homers built(5 across the street) yet my warranty claim hasn't been completed. I even called corporate.  I'm getting a lawyer on this.  Choose another company and do your research.

Update 8/15/2018 still not done.  Even after calling corporate and managers in my divison.
My warranty request still hasn't been completed since January. Do not buy from this company. They have built over 25 homes since I put in this request and still haven't finished my warranty request. I hate this company. They have no morals or value. I've lost so much money taking off work and they no show without calling. I've paid people to house sit for repairs and they no show because the warranty department dropped the ball and didn't pay invoices. The invoice I signed was only alot $1,200. This is a billion dollar company. How hard is that to pay. And they still can't come back to complete it. They dont return emails. I emailed Friday.....still nothing. 2 weeks of my home looking like trash....still nothing. Ridiculous!

name: Rameh Khazen
text:
I wanted to leave a review to point out a few key features about the Reserve at Blackstone Lakes.

First, the two home builders are separated onto two separate streets. When entering the neighborhood Truland Homes owns the lots immediately to the left, and all of the lots on the right hand side of the neighborhood, with the exclusion of the DR Horton model home.

Secondly, the homes are spaced out at least twenty feet between each other, with a ten foot minimum setback on the sides of the homes to the property line, and at least 30 feet from the home to the front or back of the property line.

Many neighborhoods in Baldwin County have the two predominate builders working in conjunction with each other to give buyers options. Firethorne, Jubilee Farms, Stonebridge and more both have DR Horton and Truland Homes building. This is a trend that will continue to give buyers a wider range of pricing and selections.

Blackstone Lakes is one of the most affordable and convenient neighborhoods Truland offers in Daphne. Square footages range from a little over 1900 square feet to over 2800 square feet, so there is something for everyone.

Hope this helps!

name: Andrew Normandeau
text:
Company & staff incredibly easy to work with. We're retiring from NY to SW Alabama and signed with Heritage Family Homes to build the Warwick on our land after numerous builder inquiries and reviews. Being 1300 miles away caused some great anxiety. The staff in this office made us feel like we were their only project.
The job supervisor stayed in constant contact sending phots of updates and continuously asked questions for approval before moving onto the next step. When a family emergency arose for the supervisor, Heritage called me immediately and gave me contact numbers for his substitutes. The super even coordinated a few extra requests with his contractors such as extra concrete for the driveway and extra soil spreading for the final outdoor clearing (We did pay for the extra but Heritage did the coordination for me).
We paid for upgrades and a screen porch on the Warwick, which really wasn't that expensive. We moved interior walls during the planning stage actually flipping the kitchen location, removed the tub from the master bath and put in a walk-in shower, removed a window from one wall and put it on another & put the garage door onto the front of the house due to yard space at no additional costs. From ground breaking until closing took 8 months with an extremely wet Alabama winter.
All said & done, Heritage came in about $30K lower than the next reliable builder. There were others but reviewing the complaints filed with Baldwin County on them really limited our choices. We were never pressured for progressive payments until we were completely satisfied.
The only reason I didn't offer 5 stars is that I had to arrange for gutters and basic landscaping (Sod and some extra property grading) because it wasn't offered. We highly suggest speaking to Heritage Family if planning on building.

We have even considered seeking legal action due to the fact we are worried that there is structural damage. We also paid about $1,200 extra to have them paint our home one neutral color, not knowing they would use the poorest quality paint. We can't even wipe our walls without the paint coming off. Honestly from the texture and appearance it just looks like primer. Lastly, anytime I call the office with any questions the guy whom answers is not knowledgeable of anything and sends me to someone's voicemail to either get a phone call back a week or more later or never. Being in the customer service industry, I am a firm believer that you should treat the customer(s) how you would want to be treated especially when they are spending thousand of dollars on a home. I am not impressed at all with this company and how they deal with problem issues. By the way, if you want to look up our contract the name is under Justin and Rachel Goree.

name: Taylor Copeland
text:
Loved my home buying team but the actual company Davidson Homes needs to improve in a couple areas. First and most importantly, The HOA board or staff needs to work on professionalism and handling situations case by case. It clearly states in the covenants that fences will not be brought forward except in special circumstances. They would not even discuss my case, just redirected me back to the covenants like I hadn’t already read them. Plus, most of the time, a fence is for privacy. I could care less about the right side of my home, but not being able to have my son’s bedroom window inside the fence for security and privacy reasons is crazy to me.
The other thing I would greatly recommend is improving the design center/appointment. A design room where we can see EVERYTHING, and not the just basic options, would cut down on the confusion and disappointment after the home is finished. I was blindly choosing things I wouldn’t have if I could’ve seen what I was choosing before hand. A full design center with every option available visible to the buyer would help a lot.

name: Katelyn G
text:
Updating my final review of Davidson Homes despite their attempt to have me sign a disclosure that I will no longer say anything negative about their company since they fixed the issues. This paper also stated that since they are committed to excellent customer service that they would cover "cosmetic" items not normally covered. It should be very clearly stated that the items were not cosmetic and actually a manufacturing defect that never should have been approved by their supers. After nearly 10 months of owning the house, our 60 day warranty items are finally resolved. Summary of issues that are now fixed --leaking chimney that caused severe damage upstairs and downstairs (took 7 months to be tarp free), water intrusion in the garage (claimed to not be considered a defect despite not being present in any other homes), cracked/misaligned window/door casings, manufacturer defect on marble vanity top that was supposed to be replaced before move in (attempted to not cover because it's "cosmetic").

My biggest frustration with them still reigns true despite the thorough completion by Chris Thompson--the amount of time and effort it took to get these things resolved is excessive and shouldn't have been necessary. The (majority of) representatives within Davidson have been friendly throughout the process including Ana Siersma, Chris Thompson, and Chad Vader. Although their production manager could use some people skills and learn to accept that in an instance such as this, the customer has every right to complain without being argued with; or without being met with rebuttals or attempted justification for all the issues or an attempt to silence their right to review. The good news for new homebuyers is that there are new managers in all departments and they will likely never need to personally interact with the production manager, but this unfortunately didn't make it any easier for all of the existing homeowners and I won't personally be able to speak on that. It may seem like I'm holding a grudge or I keep bringing up issues they fixed, and truthfully I should be allowed given the severe damage, unusability of our living spaces, and headache caused with the excessive timeline of repairs; but it's not just us with issues, I have yet to speak to a neighbor who has not had major frustrations with Davidson. So yes, I am happy that our issues are fixed, but there's no way to get rid of the bitter taste given the disaster that we were presented. However, according to a particular production manager and management who presented what can only be described as a non-disclosure since Davidson agreed to fix issues not ordinarily covered under warranty, the repairs are made so I should stop complaining. And yes, everyone has apologized profusely (some with "buts" attached to it) but that didn't change the outcome. And doesn't eliminate snarky comments such as "this is why you have a home warranty" or "you wouldn't have been able to close on time if these were identified before". Difference is, if we didn't close on time, it's not me, the customer, losing money having to pay a mortgage, it's Davidson.

The one thing that has been brought up multiple times (including our final meeting) that is one of my biggest annoyances is that we signed off on a preclose walkthrough stating there weren't the issues we're now pointing out. Our options on walkthrough were to accept that they're saying the work they did was satisfactory or not close on time. There was no in between, compromise, or room to question their work. It's not a good business practice to put homeowners in that situation and it's also worse that no one's really owned up to knowing/acknowledging that is an area of improvement and would rather argue the point. Maybe I have too high of standards coming from Florida where you don't have to choose the best of the worst which is what Huntsville/Madison is (not just me who has these sentiments, I promise). I hope that we can now enjoy owning this home because I really do l love our floorplan.

Hi Katelyn,

name: Daphne Zeigler
text:
All Concerned,

We still have the issue in our master bed/bathroom. We’ve battled through this issue the entire summer and it continues today. I’m tired of Davidson sending people over here who don’t know anymore about the issue or resolving the issue than we do. We cannot and will not continue to have our AC down to 69• or lower to accommodate our room when it causes the rest of our downstairs to feel like an icebox.

We’re not sure what was done incorrectly but we do know that something is obviously wrong and we’re not sure why Davidson is not staying on top of the issue until it’s resolved. We shouldn’t have to keep contacting you all when you know that there’s been no resolution.  Here it is at 0400 in the morning and I’m awakened because of the uncomfortable, hot and muggy temperature in our bedroom as the remainder of the house is significantly cooler. The disparity is much more than just a few degrees difference from one room to the other.

We don’t need anyone else to come here and to basically tell us that this is just how it is and this is normal because it’s not! We’ve withstood 100 plus degree weather for several months at a time in our house in Texas (temperatures were extreme) and never had this to happen. The temperature was significantly the same from one level of our house to the next; one room to the next. Similar square footage.

Davidson’s gotten away with putting terrible sod down in our yard and never watering or treating it but this will not be overlooked. We’ve watched each and everyone of our neighbors yards get treated with the proper, upmost care for weeks at a time while we’ve dealt with stony, brick laid horrible looking sod/grass. I’m assuming since we didn’t have a “Sean” working on our property, we’ve gotten the short end of the stick.

If we had to do it over again, we wouldn’t. Starting with the initial person of contact for the build.

Let us know what Davidson’s plans are to rectify this situation.

I must note that Ana has been the most positive experience that I’ve had with Davidson thus far. I appreciate her customer service, communication, and willingness to help. I only wish that she’d been the realtor (I do know that she’s not a realtor) and that Sean had been the project manager when we started this venture.

Regards,
DZ

This is the email that I sent to Davidson Homes and no one has reached out to us to discuss or to resolve the issues.  Davidson has treated us more like an inconvenience than as customers. We should’ve backed out of the deal when we initially started working with the realtor to build our plan but we went against our better judgement. Our options were not explained at all, nor were they laid out for us as they were for others in other Davidson builds. We were brushed off when we asked for details about upgrades or options. This has led us to make decisions based off of a lack of information and available options. The sod that they laid was ridiculous and they would not help us to get our grass up to part as they did for all of our neighbors. Unfortunately for us, we were the first to purchase and to move into our neighborhood and we’re paying for it in the end. Davidson has put more care and concern in the neighboring homes and not putting any effort in meeting our needs today. Our master bedroom and bath stays very humid and hot and we have no explanation or understanding as to why it’s that way. It feels like we’re walking into the garage or the attic at times.

We’re very disappointed in our new investment.

The bigger issue (more a problem with Heritage Mortgage) is if you're doing a VA loan, Davidson Homes / Heritage Mortgage will lie to you. They consider any VA non-allowable fees (borrower CAN'T pay) that the seller pays instead, to be a seller concession that counts toward their $3000 concession for using their services. So fees I'm not allowed to pay are somehow a "concession" to me. Total BS that cost me about $900. Good thing they had me fill out their survey prior to closing, because I left them a good review. name: Krystal Junge
text:
First off, a misrepresentation of how the back yard would be.  Was told a full sod back yard and the back yard has at least 4 large trees, 1 of which is a giant pine tree with limbs hanging over the house, one cluster of 12 small ones, and another cluster of 5 or so.  We asked them to let us cut the small ones and they cut the pine tree.  They told us no and we would have to wait until closing...WHEN THE BRAND NEW HOUSE IS UP!  We also explained to them that sod will not live under all of that shade, but they don’t care because they aren’t the ones going to live there!   Chantae lied and said the backyard would be bigger than the model home, well that might be, but a jungle was not what was represented!  She first said she didn’t say that at all, then later said it was taken out of context.  They are all out to cover their own behinds.

Now the windows are in, we noticed that the front window has grids.  We requested no grids at the design meeting.  We asked about it today, they said that the front window having grids is standard and there would have had to been an up charge to have no grids on that window.  This was NEVER mentioned before when we requested to have NO GRIDS.  Logan with Davidson Homes told us we can just go to Wilson Lumber when the house is closed on and buy a new  insert without grids and pop the glazing bead out to change it out ourselves. Once again taking no responsibility for it themselves.  Customer service isn’t even in their vocabulary.  And if you think they care that you aren’t happy....let me tell you, you are WRONG!!!!  Stay away from this company at ALL COST!!!  I was a trim and remodel carpenter for 8 years and now own my own home improvement company, and throughout all of the years I have never seen a contractor care so little about the homeowner!

He has never hesitated to stop and answer any question we have had as he drives by checking on other homes in our subdivision.

Within the 12 month warranty period, we had very minor issues come up. Just the normal little new home issues, a tile issue at the back door, a carpet issue, and a dishwasher issue. All of which were handled promptly by Logan in the warranty department.

Logan has also been a tremendous help in getting a drainage issue taken care of in the backyard of our home as well as our neighbors, that's wasn't just a Davidson Homes issue. It has involved the city, as well as the developer.  We can't thank Logan enough for the professional way he has handled himself with all the complaints being thrown his way from all of us involved in the issue for over a year now.

name: Roberta Walcott
text: We moved into our Davidson Home in December 2017.  We have built many homes in the past and are thrilled with the attention to detail and craftsmanship that resulted in our lovely home.  Everyone was customer service driven from the time we wrote our contract until we closed on our home.  We have only had one warranty request and I submitted the request at 7:30pm and the serviceman was at our home the next day and problem was resolved by 4:30p!  Wow, from time of submission to resolution of the warranty issue it only took 21 hours, kudos to you Davidson Homes.  No wonder I hear a lot of your customers singing your praises.  I will be referring friends and family.  Thank you for our beautiful home!

name: Stephen Nault
text: I did not buy a home, nor do I have any idea what the quality of their construction is.  However, I did attempt to buy a home from them in their Hearthstone subdivision.  The contract terms were absolutely horrible.  I have been working in real estate for over 8 years and have never seen anything so aggressive and anti-buyer.  If you plan to buy a home from them, I highly suggest using an attorney, or at minimum read every word with a ton of scrutiny.  I did attempt to resolve the problem with the builder, but they would not budge.  Even their listing agent said he understood how crazy the terms were but we "need to trust them".  Needless to say, I only trust contracts, and walked away from the deal.  Absolute waste of time even attempting to buy with this company.  I'm just glad i'm not a careless buyer, as the risks in this contract were absolutely one sided, unwarranted, and commercially unreasonable.

name: Samantha Rivord
text: Patience. Friendly.

resp.text:
Hi Samantha,

Thanks for taking the time to leave us a 5-Star review! We're happy to hear you had a positive experience with Davidson Homes!

-The Davidson Homes Team

name: Ben Webster
text:
PROS: Recently moved into one of the Jayden plans in Terrace at Savannah. Out of all their models, I think it has the best and most affordable floor plan. I really enjoyed the experience of being able to choose all the colors and our new home consultant Chantae did an amazing job at providing her input and answering any questions we had. We also chose to use Davidson’s provided realtor (which is free) and the realtor was super helpful (USE THEIR REALTOR). She updated us on the progress of the house and took videos and pictures. For the most part, everything was smooth and easy... almost too easy. The construction manager, Jerry, was very helpful and took his time to insure the house was closed and finished in a timely manner, all while insuring the tegrity and quality of the house was up to par.

CONS: We visited the house several time to insure changes we made were being implemented. (Took the advice from another review and I’m glad we did.) There were several key features and changes we had asked for that were being overlooked on the addendum. I think the root of the issue was due to our construction managers changing, however be mindful if you do have a lot of add-on and changes, try and check up on the house once a week or so.

WHAT I WOULD CHANGE: There were things that I feel should be standard that weren’t such as: numbers on the house other than just on the mailbox, a garbage disposal, gutters, and window screens (all can be added for extra cost).  There should be a choice as to what the “plant package” includes. The randomization is pretty... random and the plants were basically dead by move in time.

In all, the experience with Davidson was fun and exciting. You can tell that the people you work with along the way really care about their job and about you. I’d definitely use Davidson again given they had more unique plans to choose from in the future.

resp.text:
Hi Ben,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We value your feedback and appreciate your comments above! Thank you for allowing us to build your dream home.

-The Davidson Homes team

name: Mary Springer
text: I moved into my Davidson Home a little over a year ago. As with all new construction, there were small issues that I waited until the year warranty to submit. Upon submission, Davidson Homes was very responsive to my needs...... Logan in particular.  Though my issues were not “urgent” they treated me as if I was priority.  I appreciate the customer service I have received. And to Logan.... THANK YOU for being so patient and responsive to my requests!!!!!

name: Patricia Powers
text: They used a poor HVAC contractor who is no longer in business. Year 2 and have to replace the coil package on the unit. Of course labor not covered by warranty. HVAC system extended warranty was not registered by HVAC company. Said it was buyer responsibility and was in fine print of contract. Well how is the buyer to know registration hasn’t been taken care of if the only HVAC paperwork that was left for buyer was the install instructions for a unit that isn’t the correct model of the one installed in your house? This builder takes no responsibility for the poor quality of their contractors.

name: Farshad Ghanbari
text: Amazing home we bought in madison alabama, great materials and beautiful plan. Thank you

name: Nick Fyfe
text:
I have to say that Davidson fairly prices its homes with convenient features

Annette Forester has been an excellent community agent to work with in the Laurenwood Preserve subdivision. She is highly knowledgeable about her product and is highly involved in the building process.

But here is the Bad:

Davidson subcontractors do not respect property lines. They walk and drive their equipment all over occupied properties lawns. Davidson has been asked to keep their subs off my propety 2 times. Their subs park in muddy lots and track mud, gravel, and nails all throughout the neighborhood. Davidson only cleans the streets in the contruction area every 2 weeks.

Jacob Chandler is a the worst construction manager that my family has dealt with, and when called out on his things he hasnt corrected he blows them off.. When my framing kit was delivered it came with a roll of insulation to install behind the tubs and showers. It rained for weeks on end and the insulation was saturated. The subs went ahead and installed the insulation before installing the tub insert and prep for the master tub and shower. Multiple requests were made to Mr. Chandler for the insulation to be replaced. Instead he claimed to have his crews inspect the insulation for moisture. On my pre sheet rock walk through i reached beneath the vapor barrier in the master bathroom tub and shower area and presented Mr. Chandler with soaking wet insulation that was still in the wall. At that time Mr. Chandler removed and replaced the insulation in the bathroom. Items that were pointed out to Mr. Chandler prior to the pre sheet rock walk through with Lou and Scott Gallimore were not corrected and had to be pointed out again.

text: In my search for a home in Meridianville, I found Davidson Homes. They have a fabulous team approach for the construction process. Lori helped me with the initial contract, selection of floor plan and other options available. Ryan called with weekly updates on the progress of the construction process. Joel supervised my home's construction with the various crews and met with me several times during the process to ensure my preferences were being met. The Meridianville team met weekly to ensure the homes in the subdivision were progressing in a timely manner. Lori kept me informed on the team's progress relating to my home. Ryan coordinated and scheduled appointments from walkthroughs, to final inspection, and closing. Joel ensured all my questions and concerns had been addressed. The Davidson team were caring and professional as they built a beautiful, quality home for me. I highly recommend a Davidson's team to help plan and build a quality house for your next home.

text: Davidson Homes uses  cheap interior materials, ie flooring, light fixtures,  kitchen cabinets and bathroom counter tops. name: T Kelton
text: This company has made building my forever home a horrible experience. Because of Davidson Homes I will spend Christmas 2018 sleeping on someone's floor instead of in the new home I contracted to have built. Why? Because the contractor blames the city of Madison instead of admitting they tried to take shortcuts.  My original completion date was suppose to be in October. Then a closing date was set for Nov 12. A few days before closing I received a call telling me the backyard failed engineering inspection due to flooding. This was an issue that I had asked about before I purchased the property and asked about during the building process after visiting the site when it rained. I was told it was "OK" Then the home would not pass inspection. Davidson let the property sit for over a month with no work being done. I was told they would put a retention wall in November by Jake Blagburn.  After extending my monthly lease on my apartment 3 times I was forced to move out or pay more than double rent because I was month to month. I contacted the Sales manager Lou Paratore at Davidson and asked to help put me up in lodging. He flat out said "NO" you have to pay to live somewhere. Which is true. Yet Davidson Homes cannot give me a date as to when the home I gave them a down payment would be ready.!He then explains that work would began maybe the week before Christmas and maybe the home would be done sometime in January. I am offered no compensation only apologies. Yet for Christmas and New years I am sleeping on the floor on a air mattress while paying for storage. This company has not treated me fair and Lou Partore is very smart mouthed and disrespectful. All I have asked for is to move into the home I have a contract on and help with lodging. My only source of income is Social Security Disability and Veterans Disability and I cannot afford to pay for hotel when they cannot even give me a date that they will done.

name: Hannah Lagrone
text: I HIGHLY do not recommend going through Cumberland Homes. They put up a good front to get business from you but definitely do not care about your business. It took them almost a month and a half to set up our trailer; trim, fix cracks they put in the walls, etc. We literally had to beg, call every day, and do everything short of pulling to teeth to get them to finish setting up our trailer.  We were supposed to get a washer and dryer from them, they tried to con us out of it. We signed a contract that we had to get our own contractor to do the dirt pad.. the owner sent his family member to our house who 1. Did not know the measurements of our trailer, did a horrible job. 2. Just to try to con us out of money and we ended up having to pay another contractor to fix what they messed up. If I could give them 0 stars I definitely would. I highly suggest taking your business somewhere else. Save your money and just build a house y’all it is not worth it.

resp.text: When we trim a sheet rock house we wait until you get the power and water hooked up. it took you about 3 weeks to get the power and water to the house. When we began to trim the house, we discovered the factory did not ship all the parts, we had to order those parts. We ordered parts, received parts and trimmed your house out within two weeks of you getting power and water. You watched contractor build the site all day and at the end of the day you did not pay, and said you where not gonna pay. So that contractor did not finish. We waited on you to finish since you said that you wanted to do your own site prep. You did nothing to the site so we hired a contractor to finish the site prep. The second contractor cost about the same as what the washer and dryer cost. We asked you if you would trade the washer and dryer for site prep. So we tried to get you to pay for the site prep, you said that you would. We let you have the washer and dryer. You still have not paid for any portion of the site prep. So now you write a bad review after not paying from two different people. I would delete this review because it makes you look far worse.

name: David Mcdougal
text:
Purchased a double wide Clayton Home. We had only seen it on the video due to COVId 19. My wife spent a week (a solid 40 plus hours) trying to satisfy the requirements of the mortgage company. She couldn’t so she called to tell the salesman that we would be unable to purchase the home. He replied with, well send me what you have, I usually deal with them anyway. So the mortgage got approved. I was told by my salesman that he had gotten us approved with no payment for 90 days. One of the guys at the mortgage company actually laughed when I told him I was told 90 days no payment. We go sign papers 4/21 and cannot sign the papers in our home because they have started prepping it for delivery. We had to be out of the house we were renting so ok, this should be quick and easy. We were told a few weeks to MOVE in. It took a month just to deliver a ready home!That was 5/15. We moved in 6/10. I asked the salesman while looking him in the eyes if I would need to arrange to have the power, water, or septic tank connected. His reply to me was “no, we handle all that and it’s financed in”.
So Regional sends a man out to make our dirt pad. Supposed to be paid for in the mortgage. Guy says we need 17 loads of dirt and that we will have to either get the dirt or we could pay him around $2000 on top of what Regional was paying him for the pad work. Our lot is not that Unlevel to start with. We hired our own guy who did the pad and supplied the dirt for what Regional was going to pay their guy. They called our guy 4 times a day for a week till it got done. We are then told it was going to be another week before they delivered our home. That week comes and we are told for 5 straight days “ it’s gonna be delivered tomorrow, I promise” and it didn’t show till the end of the following week. And my wife drove an hour one way every day to meet them as she was told one of us would need to be there.So we get the septic tank installed and the water meter installed. We call our salesman to let him know and we are told that we have to provide someone to hook that up. So we get power and make the call to get our AC installed. No reply for over a week. We try to reach the general manager and can only leave messages because he is always busy and apparently doesn’t return calls between meeting (or ever). On day 3 of asking for him, the guy says, you keep calling, is there something I can help you with?. So we find out that he is the guy who arranges the AC and underpinning and finish work. He claims he hasn’t been told we had power and were ready for AC install and underpinning but he would get right on it even though three days before my wife had texted the salesman and he said he’d let them know.He called back 3 days later and said he had it set up for Monday. Monday comes and is almost gone so we call him back. He says he doesn’t know where they are and gives us the number to the AC company. They advised us that they had nothing scheduled for us to install. They simply told him they would have the unit in stock on Monday. Now the AC folks did a great job. They had a cancellation and came a day earlier than the appointment they made with us actually. I am about to make my second payment and the house is still not underpinned and we have heard nothing from the manufacturer as to when they are coming to fix all the broken drawers and the screwed up electrical. If you turn off the light outside the laundry room door to the outside, none of the lights in the living room will work.
Long story I know but I will live in a cardboard box before I buy another home from Regional Mobile Homes in Northport. We are now being told it will be another 2 to 3 weeks before they come do our underpinning. Oh and there is absolutely nothing holding this home to the ground. No straps or anchors. The Alabama Mobile Home  commission  says that it acceptable , but I have never seen a mobile home in Alabama that wasn’t strapped and anchored. They will do the minimum they can do. Not above and beyond like they say on the website. I wish I could give them negative stars.

resp.text: Hey David - I’m sorry you were unhappy with the service you received at Regional Homes. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. Since we don’t have much control over the manufacturer servicing, we do everything in our power to get issues resolved for you quickly but that’s not always the case. We will keep working hard to get these issues taken care of more promptly!

name: David B Ellard
text: Went to check out a few manufactured homes. Spoke with James and he was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the homes. Stop by and speak with James.

resp.text: Thanks for your review

name: Brittany Graham
text: James was the best! He was so kind and helpful and willing to do whatever was needed to help me out!

resp.text: Thanks for your rating and purchase. Lets us know if you ever need anything.

name: kayla gough
text:
0/5.
Very uncoordinated and no communication between employees. Very frustrating! Our sales person, James, was not knowledgeable enough to be on his own yet and got openly angry and upset that we had questions and asked for clarification on important steps. Financial person, Heath, flat out stated that they didnt care about our business because they were busy already. Information about the buying process was not shared up front. And prices 'increase' suspiciously. We even called other companies to check this info and this was not the case. Beware! Buying a home is a HUGE decision that costs a lot of money! these people are not professional and are not trustworthy. Go somewhere else!

This company will waste your time and are sleazy as grease. dont let them get a hold of your money! We were almost ready to sign with them after months of strained communication and a growing uneasy feeling in my gut, when they threw out some pretty big requirements we were never told about over 6 months of talking and preparing for a real, serious home purchase. contractors were lined up and everything. We were told prices had increased magically per foot in the house the week prior and that it required a 10% deposit on the value of the home before building...we called around to other mobile home sites and they reacted like this was the normal, to get these phone calls about this company, Cumberland Homes. Evidently we are not the first people they have done this to. the other mobile home companies in Alabama STRONGLY cautioned us that no prices had changed due to the annual convention, everything was status quo, and what they are suggesting is an unethical and NOT practiced requirement of a 10% deposit on top of the down payment for your home mortgage. You have been warned, people.

**update in response to company comment**
no sir, I am simply being thorough in my review. i have not used any "fictitious name". i simply left the same review on facebook and google. what my review states is truth. you seem to be having the tantrum because people are responding to my review with similar experiences until you took down the reviews on facebook. Let me be clear. I am not worried about you. I have not given you a second thought. i simply shared my experience to warn others. looks like yall are still stuck on it. interesting. you can speak whatever things that make you sleep better at night. I am not bitter, I am not mad, i am simply sharing the truth. I am GLAD it didnt work out now. you can excuse what you did all the ways you wish, you cannot take it back. STOP WASTING MY TIME AND MAKING YOURSELF EVEN LESS PROFESSIONAL. learn from your actions. evidently yall have reputation  that follows your company name. so sad.

Also, the "cousin" you mentioned is aware of everything and has been very cautious with you. he stayed simply because of pricing, not because he was impressed by your business. i hope you treated him better, though! it seems like it. Learning from mistakes is great.

Lastly, something to note. I only add more detail to my review when you respond unprofessionally....

resp.text: Ok,   You have already left one Review under a fictitious name and used the same type rhetoric.  Concerning the price increases,  Different Manufactured home dealers have different business arrangements with the factories based on volume and other factors so you have no idea as to what you are talking about concerning our pricing or any other Manufactured Home dealership.  Look Kayla we made a decision not to do business with you based on your behavior is the truth of the matter and this type of response from you just validates our decision.  What it seems like you are doing is simply having a tantrum because you didn't get your way.  No company wants to turn down business for obvious reasons but in your case we felt we had no choice.  Yes deposits are required on special order homes that nobody else would ever want if for some reason you can't or don't go through with the purchase is not unreasonable in our opinion.  This is the type of behavior that helped us make a decision not to do business with you and we don't regret that decision by any means.   It seems like the timing of this review is very suspicious since your cousins home will be delivering very soon and they have been very reasonable and great to work with through the whole process and we truly hope they enjoy their new home for many years to come.  We also would like to thank you for referring them to us.  Once their home is delivered we will mail your referral check.   Good luck to you in the future,  best wishes..

name: MIKE HEMPHILL
text: Terrible experience, salesman only contacted us when we needed to pay, called and left messages for him and they weren't returned. Had to contact deer valley ourselves to get the information on what it took to get the contractor in to finish. I've been treated better by used car salesman than this group of disrespectful people.

resp.text: Mr. Hemphill I am sorry that the salesman did not communicate with you the details of when your house would be finished. We have spoken with him about always communicating with the customer, He has made a mistake and I hope this mistake will not be made again. I know you are proud of the quality of your house and the great service work Deer Valley provides, I wish our sales crew would have did a better job of taken care of you.

name: Anise Morris
text: Terrible customer service. Our company buys lots of used mobile homes and we have never had an experience like this one. We wrote a check for the entire price of the mobile home based on promises made by Ron Davis. (1) He stated all appliances in good order but oven did not work-they replaced but we had to wait 1 month for replacement stove to be delivered because he apparently never ordered it; (2) Freezer worked but not refrigerator-they offered a used refrigerator but we had to pick up and install if we wanted it replaced; (3) We paid extra for skirting-took over a month for it to be installed; (4) All plumbing valves missing-out of pocket cost for repairs; (5) They lost keys to mobile home and promised to replace locks but never did; another out of pocket cost. This company seems to be only interested in making the sale but not servicing the customer. Buy elsewhere.

resp.text: I am sorry that you are unsatisfied with your used house. The house did not come with cut off valves when it was built 25 years ago. You told me the stove did not work even though we dont carry warranties on the appliances , we bought one from Lowes but they could not get in touch with you to deliver with the phone number you gave me. A month later you said the fridge did not work, so I replied that you could replace it with another if you wanted to pick it up. Send me a bill for the keys and I will refund your out of pocket cost. I did not know you did not have keys.

name: Compare and Save on Manufactured Homes
text: We have found these home to be the most energy efficient and best priced.

resp.text: Thanks

name: Cheryl Hunnicutt
text: An awful experience that we want to put behind us! DeerValley has been helpful, just wish I could say the same about Wes Madison and Cumberland.

resp.text: Cheryl if you would have asked for a heat pump we would have gladly got one for you,  you did not ask for a heat pump, you were not charged for one. That is contracted out through a different company. Cumberland Homes does not install the heating and cooling systems. And yes your house did get a leak in the plastic when it was on the lot but the factory striped everything down to the studs and replaced what ever was damaged, there is no mildew in your house ever thing that was damaged was replaced, As far as delivery, YOUR COUSIN  delivered the house, he was in charge of scheduling when he could deliver your house and it was wet the entire time he was trying to deliver. Your house had to be pulled in with a skider and your entire site had to be matted because it was so wet, that is why it took him longer to deliver. I have been out to your house to see the issues that you are speaking of, and the factory is scheduled to take care of your issues. Deer Valley is the best built house on the market, Your house is energy star compatible, thermal zone III, heat shield on the roof, Low E gold seal thermal Croft Windows. Your house  is built to conserve on heating and cooling.

name: Heather Alford
text: We tossed around the idea of a "mobile home" as it's far more affordable. However not all of these homes are created equal. They can be beautiful on the inside but very cheaply made. What's in the walls and structure counts big time. That being said, if you're considering this type of option, skip Clayton (subpar materials, building standards, still stuck in the 90s), and go here and opt for a Deer Valley home. Built w 2x6 beams, hella thick insulation, you can have recessed lighting, sheetrock walls, 9ft ceilings, the list goes on. In Alabama that wind rating is going to matter. In most brands if you want these options you're gonna pay the price like punishment for wanting a higher standard. I'll let my pictures speak for themselves on what you get for your money. Worth a look. And our salesman was no pressure but very professional. That matters bc they can usually be as bad as used car salesmen.

resp.text: Thanks for your rating and paying attention to how our homes are made.  Very educated buyer you are.

name: J nisoff
text: Very informative,answered most questions  over phone.

resp.text: Thanks J, glad we could help

name: TENA ENGLISH
text: Would have rated them 5 stars until delivery.  Excellent service and ability to provide the custom plans we requested. Impressed with the great quality of the home.  Unfortunately, six months post delivery we have still been unable to get anyone to come out to do the post delivery touch up work.  We paid for upgrades that we did not get and we have cracked dry wall throughout the house (expected after transport) that they promised would be repaired.  Many of the lighting fixtures were not installed, were broken, or completely missing.  Outdoor faucet is leaking and needs fixed before freezing weather. Several small things that will get bigger if not fixed soon.  Very disappointed and frustrated with lack of follow through.

resp.text: I am sorry you have some issues but you did not contact us until Dec, After you notified us that you had some issues, I contacted the factory. The factory took care of all your issues by February according to you. I asked if there was anything else you needed and you said you were 100% satified.

name: greg da girraffe
text: Rude service, didn't show many houses because he was "cold"...

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear your experience wasn't great. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. We would love for you to contact us so we can learn how best to improve going forward. Thanks in advance!

name: Don Kilgore
text: Best built manufactured homes...better than homes...2x6 walls, 6"crown & baseboard, etc. Very imfprmative staff.

resp.text: Thank you so much Don for the kind words!

name: Shane B
text: Bought a home earlier this year. Don was good with the purchase, no complaints there. The delivery crew broke a piece of siding on the home, I've contacted Cumberland for 2 months now and still haven't had anyone come replace it. Also, the crew that did the trim out left a huge pile of garbage in the yard as well as leaving screws in my yard, I should give 1 star just for that.  The faucet in the master bath needs to be replaced. Cumberland is well aware of this but has been putting it off for 2 months now. A plumber has come out twice now and keeps saying he needs the new faucet from the manufacturer. Basically the experience was good up until the home is actually delivery. Maybe if they see this review they will actually do their customer service, but I'm doubtful.

resp.text: I am sorry it took longer than it should to do the repair. buy Clayton the manufacturer of your home did take a long time in sending us the parts. We never received the correct part to fix your faucet so we had to  go purchase one on our own.  We should have bypassed the Manufacture to begin with but they are the one that is responsible for the warranty work. I am very sorry for your delayed service.

name: henry williamson
text: Awful customer service. Paid for a home in full around Sept 30. After waiting a month for delivery was told the mover was not qualified to move the house they would have to find another one. Have been told delivery was Monday for the past 3 weeks and still no house. Do not waste your time here.

resp.text: I am sorry  that you had to wait, I tried to get you delivered sooner but the mover I lined up said he never moved a triple wide, so I lined you with our regular mover which is 4-6 weeks out. I have since hired a 3rd mover to get us caught up. The weather has also pushed your delivery back. but your house has been delivered. Again I apologize for the delay. You will be satisfied with the quality of service, the factory trim out is the best and Deer Valley builds the best house in the industry.

name: LA
text:
Totally agree with the review posted by Gary. Purchasing a home built by Benchmark would NOT be in your best interest!! Unless you would like a huge headache by no one that cares from the GET GO. This was the first home that I’ve purchased in the area and I definitely won’t buy another from this company. I had no clue what I was in for, but if I could save someone else the devastation, DO NOT DO IT!!

A BRAND NEW HOME with NUMEROUS issues one could not even make up, all of which is a result from the obvious lack of pride and quality in their work. I am going to refrain from posting a book of a review and what energy I do have left and just say DO NOT purchase a home from Benchmark. Throw your money on the ground and walk away. Better yet, donate it to a good cause so you can at least feel good about the choice that you have made. I do hope someone takes these reviews seriously in their consideration when purchasing a home. Once I actually thought things were going to get taken care of, little did I know that this headache is never ending!! From Sheetrock seams present all over the house, to plumbing leaks, window leaks, wall bulges, fraying and dented doors, and the list goes on....all I’ve gotten is excuses as to why things are this way in order to get me to believe that these mishaps are ok and normal in a brand new home!!! NOT the case!! I’ve owned a brand new home previously in a different area and still to this day, 9 years later, I would make a bet you still could not find this type of work in that home.

If you have not gotten the message yet, you should by now!! However, let me add that NONE of this was able to be seen prior to moving in. So do yourself a favor upfront and do not even go this route, because 3 months of living in the house and things are only getting worse.

name: Gary
text:
Poor quality construction and workmanship. Calling the customer service poor is an understatement. From the beginning we had issues getting calls returned or obtaining information. This should have been an obvious red flag, but we avoided our instincts and have sorely regretted it since.

Benchmark obviously does not stand behind their product based on my experience thus far. They are not concerned with you as a customer . Once you've closed, good luck getting anything fixed. The "Superintendent" is an excuse machine from walkthrough to present day. The "warranty" department will provide you with vague generalizations and open ended time frames. If you're considering Benchmark, just toss your money out the window, it would be much more efficient.

Your closing will likely be delayed because they forgot to submit something, or do something, or just simply needed a day off. These are primarily guesses on my part because we were told nothing. We never were provided insight on the revolving closing date, until the 11th hour on the 3rd scheduled closing date. Eventually we found out our initial date passed because the COO was not submitted properly, and then the house failed inspection. Our closing was repeatedly delayed and their solution was for us to wait it out or walk, they didn't care. I would not recommend purchasing from them unless every other home in the area is sold.

name: Michael Nicholson
text: Won't help with an issue that they installed improperly. Was told tough luck!

name: William Lawrence
text: Great experience. Mr. Radcliff is awesome to work with.

name: S. A. N.
text:
Choose Benchmark Homes only if a) you don't care about the appearance of your home, b) you don't mind having unlevel floors and ceilings, c) you don't mind paying for upgrades that can't be professionally installed, d) you don't mind having woodwork done with the precision of a circus monkey, and e) you don't mind dealing with people who acknowledge that a problem exists but fail to take any action to correct it.

In the most exposed area of my home, the kitchen, the crown molding, for which I paid an upgrade fee, is falling down.  This, by the way, is the replacement work. The first installed crown molding did the same thing (started falling apart) within six months after I moved in.  The "replacement" took so long that the one year warranty had expired.

I complained about this in February, when my house was approximately 14 months old, and the superintendent came to my house to view the problem.  He said that the ceiling was  unlevel and that this was causing the problem.  He asked what days worked for me and said he would send some of his crew, which was working out of town at the moment, to fix the problem.  It's almost August, and I have yet to hear another word from the superintendent to schedule a repair.

Since I am beyond the period covered by the 2-10 home warranty, which is basically garbage anyway and only designed to protect the builder from litigation, I am stuck with the burden of correcting Benchmark's faulty work.

Choosing Benchmark Homes is one of the biggest regrets in my life.  Buyers beware!

name: Lori Reding
text: We are usibg them to build our home!

name: Becki Kemp
text: I've lived in my home for 16 years, I even stayed during hurricane Ivan and being 10 miles from the beach that wasn't wise but my house stood proud, only lost,a few tree limbs.

name: Dean watson

text: Had the closing date pushed back literally 5 times and wasn't even told about it until the week of the closing every time. Last time I had to call just to find out it was pushed back again and that was the day before my first walkthroug . Literally the only helpful person in this whole process was Racq Jordan (The Mortgage Officer). He was great with us

name: Deuce Saunders
text:
The sales rep literally just said things to sell the homes. In their advertising and contract they are selling smart homes but there is NO internet and none for the foreseeable future. How can you have a smart home with no internet? Also, they push for their closing dates so the houses are not put together well. They didn't cap things the way they should, our walls are slanted, they intentionally tried to cover shoddy workmanship, and they won't fix it. To top it off, if they do say they'll fix something, they send people that literally say "well I'm no expert, but I'll try". Who does that?
Spend your money elsewhere.

name: Madison Roman
text: Awful communication from start to finish. DR Horton can't get in touch with their contractors to fix things under warranty. They send out people that say things like "I'm not expert" or "this isn't my job, why did they send me?". The cherry on top is no internet in their "smart" homes. So, the street (Chesapeake) was contracted as a smart home, but there is no day in sight when we will have internet, or the other incentives they promised (video doorbell, alexa, echo, $500 in additional smart home technology).

name: Madison Roman
text: DO NOT BUY, NO INTERNET AND NO PLANS FOR INTERNET DESPITE SELLING SMART HOMES

name: celeste mohon
text: We had a wonderful experience with Gwendolyn Gilley Construction. From our first meeting we were impressed with their knowledge and ability to talk in detail and give estimate based on the plan we walked in with. They were very hands on and communicated with us several times a day throughout our building process. They stay on top of their contractors to get the job done in a timely manner. We broke ground in May and moved in the first week of January. We could not love our home more and highly recommend GCC!

resp.text: Thank you for the review and your kind words! It was a pleasure to work for y'all!!

name: Chris Mohon
text: We highly recommend Gwendolyn Gilley Construction. At our first meeting we agreed upon a number and we didn't go over it even amidst the soaring COVID prices. We had daily communication, sometimes multiple times a day, and he stayed on top of contractors and worked to ensure timely completion of a job. We are so grateful that we chose GCC to build our dream home!

resp.text: Thank you for the review and your kind words! It was a pleasure to work for y'all!!

If our record are wrong and you have purchased a home from us please contact us immediately so we can address these issues you're experiencing.

name: S
text: Poor construction and not professional quality. Not what you would expect when they say “luxury” farm house. They left trash all over the house and throughout the yard. Tile work is terrible. text: Brooke Pierce is a wonderful realtor.  She sold my house, found another house which I purchased, and also helped with the purchase of land.  Brooke is very responsive to phone calls, texts, and emails.  She even responded while on vacation.  She was able to answer all of my questions.  I took a  long time to purchase a home and Brooke took me to 25+ homes without question or complaint and at the time and day I wanted.  Brooke was recommended to me by a colleague and I would recommend her to anyone searching for a home in the greater Auburn Area.

resp.text: Thank you, Reece! We are so glad you had an exceptional experience. Brooke is a great REALTOR and we'll make sure and pass along your comments. Please let us know if we can be of service again.

name: Casey Sloan
text:
We met Duffy as the selling agent of a house we scheduled a tour for in our preferred search area. During the tour, she was extremely professional, wore PPE, offered sanitizing wipes, and it became obvious to us that she knew our preferred area very well. Her thoughtfulness and knowledge made her an easy choice for us when our dream home hit a very competitive market. She immediately went to work. Because of her late-night efforts and quick work, we had an approved offer literally overnight! Things were moving so quickly, we are absolutely positive that we would have missed out on the opportunity to own this new home without her at the wheel. From there, Duffy always offered to help and oblige us when schedules conflicted and details became more difficult in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.

All in all, Duffy Stewart knows her stuff, she’ll do whatever it takes to help you as her client, and she will get results!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Casey. As you've experienced, local knowledge and speed are important traits in this fast-paced market. Duffy knows her stuff and we couldn't be more thrilled to have you as a happy client. Thank you for putting your trust in Duffy and BHHS.

name: Chukkuls
text: They are a custom home builder in the same way a microwaved vending machine hot dog is a great meal. If you are in a pinch, sometimes you have to take whatever is available.  My take is that there are lots of other good choices, so don’t settle for the lowest grade unless you have no other options.

name: Sandi Fields
text: I was attempting to have a house built by this company.  Soon after I made a deposit of earnest money the area was hit directly by a hurricane. I promptly requested to cancel my contract and they are refusing to refund my money. The sales agent - Sue Vancleave commented that fires in California (where I am from) cause more damage and death than a hurricane. Since I live nowhere near any fires I don't consider this a good reason to keep my money. I have since read many negative reviews and complaints with the Better Business bureau- which they aren't even accredited for.

name: Don Hembree
text: We had them build a family home in Orange Beach Alabama and were very disappointed. We were going to purchase a second home that they constructed in the area but after our dealings with them on  the construction project decided against this.  I have been in the construction industry for over 30+ years and this is a very disorganized company They that do not communicate and always try to blame others for their shortcomings instead of taking responsibility for issues and correcting them. I would never have them build another house. They are such a large company that they think they can do whatever they would like without any accountability. Run from this company. There are many other good quality homebuilders that will be more honest in their dealings.

name: Sally Smith
text: We were voted off the island by Trueland Homes y'all.  Tips for new buyers...do NOT ask any questions or express any concerns.  We were told by the builder themselves...Trueland Homes is not the right builder for us.  Read all the Reviews folks and make an informed decision.  See for yourself and visit the models with crooked walls, crooked trim, wavy flooring, loud A/C units inside the homes and cracked cement work. Talk with the neighbors in all their subdivisions. The best thing that could have happened to us was them turning away our $250,000.

name: cbmiro
text:
I read all the reviews after buying regarding poor warranty service. right after buying I noticed irrigation didn't cover the yard. After several attempts Truland kept moving the goal posts, basically they don't fix anything they say they will do. I'm just waiting to find other problems. I had a hard time getting them to correct problems prior to closing but I held my ground, I suggest if buying a home from them have a GOOD inspector and go through everything with them. The customer service is horrible.

I've just noticed there is a very good contractor that did a build for me in the past that I would HIGHLY recommend, he posted a negative review...wish I would have spoke to him. Do your homework, I suspect the good reviews.

EDIT 8-18-2020
Just seen the response from the builder. LOL!! I've had multiple warranty requests for the same issue. Not only has your company stalled they are not fixing the problem. I've continued to contact you and ask you to fix the needed repairs, YOU DONT! I change my advice, buy from someone else! Improperly used, canned responses can prove frustrating to users by providing inadequate answers)

text:
Unfortuately, we have had a challenging experience with Truland Homes. Too many frustrations to list, honestly.  I’m still, over a year later, dealing with an issue from our 30 day punch list. Also dealing with 1 warranty issue on our door from September that I can’t ever get a response or a call back on. I would not recommend this builder unless you have a lot
of patience and no expectations that they will provide timely customer service.

name: JCKK L
text: There needs to be better quality control over the finishing in these houses. There’s so many things we’ve found wrong and have added to the warranty to get fixed...too many things in my opinion that should have been done correctly the first time. Like we wouldn’t notice! I think the problem is that Truland has so many houses being built at once and not enough supervision on site to go around. This has caused many of the issues we’ve discovered with the home. For things to be corrected on site they have to be discovered when they occur, not months later, not at the last minute right before closing. For initial walkthrough to closing, the 7 days Truland gives is not nearly enough time to fix things. Ultimately, for as much as we paid for our home, we were expecting much better quality/finishing of build. Also, the community pool (Cypress Village) is an absolute joke. All the listing/internet photos falsely advertise this feature. I’m sure it was once a gorgeous pool and lazy river but the lack of maintenance over the years is obvious. We had to sign a waiver from the HOA that we wouldn’t sue if we were injured there. Attempting to use the slide, we soon found out why. Also, the cypress trees as you enter the community are dying. I hope this is not a sign of the future of this community. I know this falls on the HOA, but as far as I understand it, Truland still has oversight of these items. These are low points from our Truland experience. On the positive, we are happy to be in Orange Beach and the community seems very safe with lots to do. I just hope all of our warranty items can get resolved sooner than some of those people’s in the other reviews, and that they fix up the pool and the trees that are dying.

name: Stephen Davis
text:
If you are looking for a high quality built home constructed on time by honest people who work for a company with integrity, then do not choose Signature Homes at Brock Point. From the first interaction we had until the most recent as of yesterday, the employees at Brock Point have been dishonest with us. Once they lock you in through their deceitful sales tactics you are along for a horrible ride.

We were told 7-8 months from Contract to Close (possibly 6). After revised dates after revised dates it now stands at 11 1/2 months to Close. All we keeping getting from Signature Homes is they are behind schedule with no recovery plan or attempt to make up any time. They continue to work on spec homes while people who have Contracts wait. This occurred with many people in Brock Point and continues.

The amount of quality issues has been enormous. From plumbing being placed in the wrong location in the slab (required jacking up the floor) to retaining walls being poured too high to the house being painted the wrong color, it has been a comedy of errors. The framing was a complete QC nightmare with more issues than I can type. We can only imagine what’s left to come.

There aren’t many choices in the Hoover School District to build a new home. However, we suggest looking long and hard at other subdivisions. It is possible other Signature Homes subdivisions aren’t this bad, but is unlikely given the people we have spoken to and conducted meetings with control the overall company. Good luck to all those that still have homes to build with Brock Point!

EDIT: We officially moved in 2 weeks ago after 11 1/2 months from Contract. There is a already a leak above our Master Bedroom and our ceiling is ruined. I can't wait to see how the repair goes. Also, we have a list of 50+ warranty items that need addressing.

name: Jason Mardis
text: Been over 6 months and we still have unresolved issues from our walkthrough. When we have scheduled times for them to show up to work on those issues, not only do they not show up, they do not notify us they are not showing up. We are also the ones having to reach out to reschedule. Overall, a very poor experience. I would not recommend buying a home from signature, very poor customer service, especially since they push their warranty as a selling point.

text:
As a first time homeowner, Lowder New Home, I was nervous of not knowing what to expect. Upon my arrival Mrs. Suzanne Mathison-Smith, Sales Manager, greeted me, at the door with a welcoming smile. She made me felt very relaxed. Afterward, Mrs. Smith explained  new construction home building phases, as to who I will be meeting with. During our meeting on upgrades, Mrs. Smith, recommended blinds and irrigation system was a great suggestion which was appreciated. name: Christen Edwards
text: Very disappointed with this company. I signed the contract to build. I was initially supposed to have my pre-construction meeting in January. Unfortunately, my family had an unexpected death the same week and had to reschedule. The next available appointment wasn’t until February. After I had the pre-construction meeting with the construction manager, I received and signed the meeting notes that had the “pricing” based on the selections made. I received an email over a week later notifying me that because I had to reschedule the pre-construction meeting my construction date had to be pushed out and the price of the house increased by over $30,000! So now I am back at square one looking for my next home.  This just may be my blessing in disguise. If a company doesn’t see you for more than a dollar, then maybe they don’t deserve my money.  I’m truly shocked and disappointed by the lack of empathy shown given the situation. I’ll never recommend anyone to this builder just based on this experience alone. I’ve heard of nightmare stories, but I never imagined this would really happen. I get that companies are in the business to make a profit, but I do not believe that in less than a month the price we agreed to per our signed contract should have increased by over $30,000. I understand that there is an influx in this market however you don’t tell me a week after sending me documents to sign (which I did) that my contract is null and void due to market demands. It’s really devastating that a company that has built its reputation on people and prides itself on the best interest of the customer would do just the opposite. They violated our trust and have shown that they have no integrity. What was meant to be an unforgettable positive experience of homeownership is now a reality of uncertainty and anxiety simply because we believed this “reputable” company would stand by its word.

resp.text: We regret we had to do this as well.  We put the price escalation clause in your agreement to protect both Murphy Homes and our customers.  Current market conditions are causing incredibly difficult labor and material shortages.  Our cost inflation is so aggressive that we simply cannot build a home we are proud of without agreeing to nearly weekly increases in material and labor.  The revised price we offered was well below our current sales price.  For what it is worth, It was also below our breakeven price.  Again, we sincerely regret this happened and we hope you find a new home that fits your needs.  Thank you for considering us.

name: C B
text:
The selection process was pretty straight forward and simple. It was nice having a decent number of choices and Charlie/Cindy helped a bunch answering questions and suggestions.

As a whole, we still love our house and the neighborhood. It's a great location, nice neighbors, quiet, and will be a great place to raise our family.

On the house itself, during and after build, quite a bit of poor quality work kept being attempted to be passed off as normal.

Limited quality control appeared to be performed. There were obvious issues that they just ignored; mostly cosmetic but some big ones too with outlets (see below).

It was known this was our first home purchase and I really feel they tried to take advantage of that. Instead of doing things right, they appeared to cut some corners and I guess hope we wouldn't notice or know any better.

It is disappointing when, based on reviews, it seemed like it'd be a stress free and streamlined process from a local company.

Some of the good stuff:
- Working with Cindy on selections was great. She really helped get things in order. Same with the Richards lighting folks who were great as well.

- We really like the flooring (Cindy really helped out with us picking them!). Wolde did a good job making it look good.

- Overall we love the kitchen. They did an extended counter/cabinets and moved pantry shelves to the large side closet instead. Got plenty of counter space with lots of storage - exactly what we wanted.

Example of issues:

- Improper outlet installations. Backstab connections on most, box recessed too far and mounted incorrectly (exposed drywall screws through box into stud), and drywall screws to attach outlet to boxes.

- Bad outlet cutouts. Large chunks of drywall missing and tried to hide it with plate covers. Some of the holes were even outside the plates.

- Ceiling drywall seams are very noticeable with bumps, tape edge, etc visible. For open plan and this lighting, a higher level drywall finish was needed.

- Venthood was originally installed with no seal to the attic, just left open. They did come and spray foam up in it to seal it but should have been addressed by MH checks.

- Stove is different model than what we ordered. Nobody called to let us know original not available anymore - it was a slide in, this one is free standing. Had I known I would have changed to a cooktop (prefer stoves with overhanging tops which this one is not).

Edit:
Dropping to 1 star due to behavior of sub-contractors. Electrician walked in arguing, wouldn't listen to any concerns, everything was fine even if another electrician said it wasn't - and I have their report.

If you feel someone is wrong, discuss it and show why. Don't step into the house with an attitude unwilling to even listen to customer concerns.

resp.text: Hey Chris, we will keep working with you until we get these items cleared up.  Thank you for the feed back and hopefully we will have those negative items turned into positives very soon!
