name: Rick Harris
text:
Lisenby Construction just finished a three-week remodel of our kitchen and living room, and we could not be more pleased.  The project involved demo of some existing kitchen cabinets, replacement of a cook top and stove with a range, replacement of a vent hood, installing new kitchen lighting, laying tile, painting cabinets and bookshelves, painting trim, and painting walls.  All of this was handled by David's crew without having to sub out any work. The quality of the work done was really top-tier.  We used David's decorating consultant, Lindy, to help pick out colors, and the result has significantly brightened and beautified the two rooms where we spend most of our waking hours.

When you undertake a project that takes this much time, you quickly realize that you have invited some strangers into your home for a lengthy stay.   Well, the guys David sent did not stay strangers for very long.  They were cheerful, friendly, and helpful to us.  They added, without cost, some features to the project at our request, even though these features were not in the original contract-- for example, installing a dimmer switch in the kitchen, replacing flood lights in our dinette area so they would match the color put out by our new kitchen lighting, cutting out the trim along one wall of our living room so our bookcase could lay flat against the wall, and installing wall outlets in our bookcase.  They cleaned up after themselves every day and hauled away their own trash.  When they moved furniture around to do some painting, they always put it back where it had been.  It got to where we enjoyed having the company at our house.  At the end of the job, we were glad it was completed, but we were sorry to see the guys leave.

All the work was done with great attention to detail.  They found and installed tile to match our existing kitchen backsplash tile.  They worked on our project every weekday for three weeks.  On some days, they worked on our cabinet doors and bookcase at their shop, but on the days when they did not come, David always called us to let us know they would not be there and what they would be doing that day.

We will certainly call on Lisenby Construction if we undertake new remodeling projects.  Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you Rick for your kind words and for trusting us with your home remodeling needs!

name: Susan Schneider

text: This was our first remodel, and it could not have gone smoother! The team was easy to talk to, and they were easy to reach when we had questions. They kept us up-to-date on expectations and the timing of everything. The remodel took 4 days (from demo to completion). The team arrived early each day, and they even worked holidays. They cleaned up daily (vacuumed and cleaned stainless steel appliances). We were also impressed when working with a company they contracted with. While the other company was doing their part, the Lisenby team was present, and they made sure the job was done right/well. In fact, at one point, the Lisenby team told the other team to fix something before leaving. Overall, we were highly impressed, and we intend to work with Lisenby again in the near future when we do additional remodeling!

text: I am so disappointed and frustrated withmy entire experience with Adams homes. We purchased a brand new home from them for almost 200k expecting the quality of the home to match the price. The cabinets are barley glued together and keep coming apart as well as numerous places in our walls and ceiling have started to crack. However, our biggest issue is that our home which is less than two years old has multiple roof leaks, I have attempted to get them looked at and repaired for almost a month now. The general manager came out and said that they would get a roofer out to look at them, I have emailed numerous times with no responses, I have called and was told it would be handled and nothing is done then I was told the roofer would be at home and they never showed. I have now emailed 5 times and called 5 times with no resolution in sight. I am so disappointed in Adams homes and their quality, their professionalism and pretty much everything thing about their homes and business. I will never purchase another home built by them and I will ensure my family and friends do not either.

name: Michael Bolden Jr.
text: In full disclosure, this is the second home I've purchased from Adams.  My first home they did a great job and I couldn't have been happier.  With that being said, the second time around using them as a builder has been a HORRIBLE experience and I will NEVER consider buying another home from them.  Both homes that I purchased from them were brand new and built from the ground up.  I have had issues from the first day I stepped foot into my home that were not easily seen during the walk thru.  Multiple issues from the truss to the flooring/foundation(water coming up through the flooring/tiles) to a water damaged door.  I closed on my home in January of 2016 and we are now in July of 2017 and I still have issues that haven't been resolved and are on going.  One of which I believe is a serious issue but they are trying to quick fix it so I will move on.  I've had water/moisture come up through my flooring and it's an issue that they said they've never seen before(lucky me).  They seem to be passing the ball from one person to the next.  It took months to have a simple interior door replaced and I'm still waiting to have the door painted months later!  I've called numerous times and was told that someone would contact me only to have no one contact me.  Emails that have not been responded to and once I finally get someone on the phone, I'm told that my email was received and she had been meaning to call me.  Weeks have gone by at a time with no contact from Adam's and if you call their corporate office, they simply say that all warranty issues are handled in the field and not by corporate.  I still have exposed flooring that guest have to step over and it's ridiculous!!  I've NEVER done a review of any company in a negative manner and I could go on for days but I just wanted to save another potential Adam's Home customer the heartache!  It's tiring and stressful trying to run down a company to fix issues that are a result of their workmanship, especially when you work full time and have a family to take care of!  This is not what you envision when you spend hundreds of thousands of dollars on a product!! Your experience maybe different but I wouldn't recommend them to anyone!!  My next home will be a Truland or a complete custom builder!

name: Janna Parris
text: Not long after submitting a request for a quote, I received a call from Marc. He was very professional and got all the information before coming to my home. When he arrived, I was late, he was very professional in waiting on me and extremely courteous. He provided me with two estimates, one for what we had (3 tab laminate) and one for the HD 3d roofing. There was not a large price difference between the two, which is normally marked up with other roofers. He also presented his business license and insurance up front without me having to ask. He was extremely easy to get in contact with and answered any time I called, by name. He made this an amazing experience where I never had to wonder what would happen next. He came in $3000 less than the other two estimates we received. There was never any pressure for us to go with this company and we have a better warranty than other roofers for labor and materials. The price was exactly as quoted with no hidden fees. Everything happened as he said it would. Seamless process for an otherwise hectic problem of having to have a roof replaced. I would recommend him to absolutely anyone. Several neighbors have had new roofs put on and ours is by far the best in the neighborhood. There aren't enough words for the appreciation I have for him. I am also a homeowners insurance adjuster, which makes it even more impressive to me.

name: Faith Boone
text:
Response to the owner’s “reply”:
So your hostile response and assumption on my character are highly unwarranted and attests to your character. A review is simply that, my opinion based on my experiences. You, however sir, have turned this into something else and are taking a path that I choose not to follow. It is not that I did not want to “do the work”. I do not have to list my credentials to prove something to someone who in the grand scheme of things does not matter. I have 10 millions things going on in my life. From speaking with other people who had roof repairs, I was informed that the repair company does that part. So I based my expectations off of what many people, including people in your profession, explained to me about the process. In MY OPINION, which is what this is, I felt it could have been handled better. As stated before, you seemed disinterested from the beginning of the conversation but I chose to continue on because of the amazing reviews you received. At the end of the day, I am above this. For the record, I have contacted a company who will come out and assess the damages and give me a quote that I plan to pay for myself if that is what it comes to. Lastly, I have adjusted the ranking because clearly “stars” are more important that people. I am in no way here to damage anyone’s reputation. Some people take constructive criticism better than others. I’m sure that as successful as you are, you neither need or desire my business. I truly wish you much success in all that you do and pray you have an amazing evening.

I was highly disappointed with my experience, especially considering all of the amazing reviews. I called and left a message with a representative who said I’d receive a call back. True enough, I did; however, everything seemed rushed and the gentleman seemed disinterested from the beginning. I explained that I had some leakages that an inspector felt could have resulted from hail damage and that I was interested in getting an evaluation. I feel as if the man I spoke to felt that I had no point of reference just by some of his questions and comments. After telling him that I had another company come out weeks prior who did an inspection and said I had a valid claim, the man I was speaking with all of a sudden seemed interested in what I had to say. Further conversation revealed that my policy was transferred to a new company and that there may not be a storm that I could link the damages to under my new policy, which is understandable. From that point on, all conversation had a negative undertone and seemed as if it was a race to end the call. My biggest disappointment came in when he recommended that I personally look for a storm with a date that correlates to the damages and call him back if I find one. He said he’d do the same. Needless to say, that was 3+ weeks ago. I do not feel that it is my responsibility to find a storm. The other company did all of that for me. I did not go with them due to poor communication and failure to call back in a timely fashion (like more than a week passed when I was supposed to receive a return call within 24 hrs). I am glad everyone else had a great experience and am sad to say that mine was quite contrary.

resp.text:
This negative review is in no way reasonable or justified. I do appreciate that she acknowledged that we promptly returned her call, which we always try very hard to do, but beyond the truth in that, her complaint against us is totally unwarranted.
This person wants to file a claim against her insurance company for hail damage to her roof. She told me that she changed insurance companies at the end of last year. I explained to her that in order to start the claims process her present insurance company will want to know the date of the hail storm that damaged her roof, in order for them to confirm (or deny) coverage. I told her that I am unaware of any hail storms that occurred so far this year that would help her to start a legitimate claim against her present company. I told her that I could be mistaken, and encouraged her to do some research and maybe she will learn of a storm that I am not aware of. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is an excellent governmental reference point for weather history.
The issue is not whether she has hail damage on her roof, but rather whether she can make a claim for the damage against her present insurance company, so it will pay for it. It appears that she can't.
Her complaint against us is clearly rooted in her notion that she didn't want to be bothered to have to put any effort into the fact-gathering element of making a claim with her insurance company. She didn't want to "… personally look for a storm with a date that correlates to the damages and call him back". This is her "biggest disappointment". She obviously feels that someone else should do everything for her. I simply explained to her that there can be no claim for hail damage against her present company without a hail storm that occurred while insured with her present company. This is a person who has shot the messenger who brings disappointing news.
We have a long list of hard earned and well deserved stellar reviews. This solitary negative review has nothing to do with our work product or our customer service. This review comes from someone who simply wants what she wants, and who got offended by the suggestion of having to put any personal effort into getting what she wants and gets mad at the person who explains to her why she can't have what she wants.

name: Vincy Lwanga
text:
Replacing a roof is not a routine job and neither is it done frequently.  Referrals by mouth are rare and I did not have anyone I knew who had replaced their roof recently. Searching the websites was my only option. I decided to call roofers nearby or within my Zip Code.  Alabama Discount Roofing and three others were on the BBB website. I read the reviews and settled on three.  I called Alabama Discount Roofing and Marc was very nice to agree to meet with me on Sunday to accommodate my schedule. When Marc came, he was professional, respectful and did not put pressure on me to make a decision. I had prepared a list of questions to ask him but I only asked a few questions because he was very well prepared; he brought all his paper work for the licenses and insurances.  He also had prepared three different estimates: one for the 3 tab Asphalt Shingles, Architectural Shingles and the Metal roofing which he left with me and also samples of the shingles.  This gave me an idea what is available and what it will cost me. In addition, he brought with him a reference list with 17 names to contact if I had more questions. I told him that I had two other companies I wanted to meet with and then will call him back once I get their quotes. One company left their estimate on the door and I was not able to talk to them in personal but communicated by phone. The other company came in and we met but did not have all the details of paper work as Marc had prepared for me. I relied on what they told me. One had a lower price but did not tell what shingles they were going to use. Alabama Discount Roofing also gave me a five year labor and workmanship Leak Free Warranty while the other two gave me a two year Warranty. I made a choice to go with Alabama Discount Roofing and the Architectural shingles. The materials were delivered a day before and the next day, on 11/09/ 2016 before 7:00 am, the workers arrived. They were organized, worked fast and each one seemed to know what he was doing on the site. I had a few question and they answered my questions or I called Marc and he explained.  Since I was at work, Marc made sure he sent photos of the progress and at the end he sent me more pictures of the completed job. Marc did not ask me to pay up front and this made me more comfortable. The cleaning was amazing. I have not found any nails or debris left behind. It seems like they were never here. At the end of day, I met with Marc and he made sure I had no further questions or concerns. Would I recommend this company to any one? Absolutely yes, this is a professional company with a personal touch. Excellent customer service and my estimates and the actual cost were not far apart.
VL

name: Adrian Perez
text:
This review is for Davidson Homes at the Dairy from a person who has been remodeling houses for nearly 2 decades. First and foremost, homes are built 100% by people and as such are susceptible to human error. The homes here in the dairy are not by any stretch of the imagination to be considered top quality homes. They are also not the worst in the industry, but do expect to have some trouble in years 0-3. Final product looks good, especially from the curb. Attention to detail lacks which comes with  territory when homes are built as fast as these are but they are priced competitively. One of the biggest issues I have observed (biggest impact by time, cost and inconvenience) is the quality of the drywall work. In particular the ceiling seams. You will begin to see bulging and cracking between 6months to 2 years (the model home and several neighbors had cracks after 6-8 months). In 20 years of remodeling in climates from as far south as Florida to Northern Virginia, only times drywall seams crack is when improper drying, support, taping, and or mudding was done.
Additionally, dealing with the 1 year warranty work has been challenging to say the least which is another common issue (complaint shared by multiple neighbors). If this review were solely based on that experience, it would be 1 star or less but that would not be fair to the builder.
The question of course is would I do it again knowing what I now know. The answer to that is yes, but with 60% confidence provided there was a way to mitigate drywall and warranty issues to name a few.

name: Patrick Nelson
text:
I think the pictures below pretty much speak to the quality you can expect from Woodland.  I've have tried calling their sales office, I was told to call corporate, I called corporate and got voicemail.

My house is about 4 years old.  Well out of warranty.  But, most of the poor workmanship appears after the warranty period has ended.  My master bath and entrance to our master bedroom has severe structural problems.  The cracks you see have been re-plastered and painted more than once.  Forget about doors closing properly.  The doors have been trimmed to such an extent that a new door will be required for the bedroom.  The framing issues you may have will not be covered by your warranty and will not appear until a few years after you own your home.  Once they do, you will find yourself spending a lot of money to repair.

If framing were the only issue, I probably would not write the review.  I never do this kind of thing.  But the electrical was done so poorly that it nearly burned the house down.  The left exposes copper to aluminum high voltage line exposed in a junction box.  The result was blowing out the double oven's control panel.  This resulted in an expensive repair to the ovens, but could have easily resulted in a fire.   Again-- the kind of thing that happens well after your warranty period has expired.

The problem I have with Woodland, is that their "quality" is only skin deep.  They have a great marketing staff, but once your in your house and a year has passed you are on your own to deal with the poor workmanship that lies just below the surface.  No builder is perfect.  But, it would be nice if they built to code.  I have more pictures if you are interested.

name: Joy Wink
text: We love Woodland Home! This is our second home purchase with them. They were professional and very organized through our home building experience. Thank you so much Woodland Homes Team! You are the best!

resp.text: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us!

name: Blake
text:
Let it be known that I’ve given Woodland over a year and a half to make themselves better before writing this review and they have continued to be just as much of a disappointment as they were since the day we closed.

First, don’t let them convince you to close and that your outstanding items will get fixed within 30 days. The sub-contractors don’t keep up with their warranty repairs and Woodland doesn’t follow-up with you after closing unless you are constantly in contact with them. Check my review of Custom Interior Trim to see just how their subs act and treat customers.

Their warranty team is an absolute joke. They don’t follow-up, they don’t coordinate, and if you aren’t keeping them in line, they just let your items slide off the radar.

They have shown a complete lack of professionalism ever since we closed. I will admit, we love the house itself. It’s good quality, the design process was fun, and we felt like the options they had to choose from were exactly in line with what we wanted, but the worst mistake I ever made was trusting that they would continue their great service after having closed on the house. If you don’t listen to anything else, just hear me when I say do NOT let them close on your house until they finish everything. It has truly been bad enough that I regret ever choosing them as a builder, no matter how much we do like the house itself.

And again, if I’m being completely honest, the staff that they have are nice people. I mean I have legitimately enjoyed dealing with most of their staff, but I’ve also had to do their job for them. I have to do all of the follow-up to make sure people are showing up to do their warranty repairs. I’ve had to coordinate with the warranty department and the subs to make sure they had all of the correction items listed.

It’s exhausting dealing with Woodland and their lack of support for Warranty customers. I’ve told them this multiple times, but if they would put just as much care into how they treat and deal with Warranty customers as they do with new customers still in the building process, they would be a nearly flawless business. Until then, they deserve this negative review and more. I’ve spoken with multiple people in my neighborhood who can corroborate this story and would say the same thing themselves. We have warned people we know away from Woodland specifically because of this and away from some of the specific sub contractors they use. Horrible customer service, dismal professionalism, and a demeanor that says “you as a customer don’t matter to us as much as the new build customers.”

resp.text:
Blake,

Thank you for the kind words regarding your home building experience with Woodland Homes. We are happy to hear that you had a fun experience and enjoyed our process of building. Next, we would like to say that we understand your frustrations with warranty. We are in fact struggling with time lines and subcontractors. At this time North Alabama and surrounding areas are experiencing a housing boom. This combined with the struggles of building a product in the midst’s of a global pandemic have made it difficult to obtain products for some of our customers warranty requests.

It is also difficult to keep subs motivated when they have so much work to choose from in front of them. This is just the honest truth, and the reality of the world we are living in.  That said we understand it is frustrating to wait on your items to be completed. While it may take us a little longer to complete a warranty item we are getting to all of our customers and completing their warranty requests. In fact, we have even extended specific warrantable items past the agreed upon 1 year term in order to ensure our customers are happy, and have their items completed .

Since we don’t know your full name there is no way to reach out directly. We would encourage you to call your onsite sales person and get them involved to assist you, or even call our corporate office and ask for the president of the company. He will be happy to work directly with you.

name: Dina Boley
text: Woodland Homes was outstanding building our home!  We loved the out of town service we received when buying from West coast.  The staff helped us every step of the way!  We love our beautiful home.  We couldn’t be happier!

name: Aisha Buycks Realtor (Huntsville Madison AL)
text:
Woodland Homes is a local builder who builds beautiful neighborhoods and homes. They are generally in a nature rich area and provide green spaces within their communities. Most neighborhoods start at mid $300K and go up. There may be a few neighborhoods available at a lower point.

Their process is pretty easy and they are Realtor friendly. Pretty much anything you could want they have the ability to make it happen. You are not limited on your customization as long as you don't price yourself out the neighborhood.

They offer a variety of available styles homes such as garden homes, townhouses, craftsmen bungalows, traditional style homes. Their level of quality in any home they build is generally Executive level. The offer and array of floorplans and amenities within their communities.

If you are in need of someone to assist you while navigating your purchase process with Woodland I am definitely available to help. You can click on my name to acquire my contact.

text: Working with Morgan on our house closing was a pleasure. She is very professional and kept us fully informed.  So far we are pleased with the overall craftsmanship and also enjoy the neighborhood.

name: Disappointed Home Buyer
text: The initial phase of the home buying process was great. The personnel in the home office were welcoming and professional. During the build I hired a home inspector who found major errors with the home. This information was relayed to the site manager and many of the errors were overlooked and I’m still dealing with them. Upon walking through my home I found basic issues with the craftsmanship that should’ve been addressed by the site manager, if he had completed a walk thru of the home. Once the home was complete a final walk thru was scheduled. I found the same issues as the last walk thru. At this point, if you don’t address the problem it’s often overlooked. I refused to sign for the keys. As a buyer I felt rushed to sign for the keys to the home, that wasn’t ready. I was promised the issues would be addressed in a timely manner, “I’M STILL WAITING”. I still have a page of outstanding issues with my home. As a premier builder I expected more. The subcontractors provided poor quality of work. No disrespect, but the attention to detail lacked, for my home. I hope no one has to go through what I did. I’m not sure if it’s due to the number of homes Woodland is trying to build or is this the standard issue with Woodland across the board. I didn’t want to come off as a complainer, so I asked around my neighborhood and many of us shared the same problems. This is not to bash Woodland. The homes, cosmetically looks great, I think more effort needs to be made to build a better quality home for the price and oversight of the subcontractors is a must. If this doesn’t happen hold the site manager accountable. The warranty department shouldn’t make people feel like they are the problem. The subcontractors need to do their job and provide a quality product. If I had to do it all again I would definitely ask around the neighborhood where I’m buying and meet one on one with the builder. The company should accommodate, people are spending a lot of money on these homes.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. We pride ourselves in our builders and customer service. If you would please call our office directly, we can address any of your concerns or questions directly. We are sorry to hear this but look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you again.

name: Vinson Moore
text: I have looked at Woodland Homes on Green Mountain, Huntsville Al. It actually defies logic that I could desire so much to live there, be impressed with what I saw, and have the experiences I have had. Maybe it is coincidence but I don’t think so. I will simply state what happened and let the reader decide. I have seriously looked at Woodland homes 4 times. The first experience was positive but I was afraid of the road in and out of the area so I decided not to buy. The last 3 times I had resolved that fear and wanted to purchase a house from Woodland homes. The first of these three, I spoke with an associate. He showed me a lot and gave me a price for a home on the lot. He said we had to see his boss. I did so and she literally panicked. She said he gave me the wrong price. I said ok and left. The second of these 3 times, Woodland homes sent me an email with an advertisement for a house already built. It was priced in the range we were looking for. We made an appointment with the aforementioned realtor and spent 30 minutes looking at the home. It had one feature we did not like but we were about to make an offer when she said oh no, this house has been sold. She added, but we can build you one like it on another lot. We spent a couple of hours looking at lots and found 3 we liked. She said she would send us the prices on all three. The result was that the lot we wanted was not available for the house we wanted to build on it and the other two had prices that were 40 to 50 thousand dollars more than the one we looked at. Not exactly the same price...The last time my wife met with a different realtor and got prices for several models one of which was built and the other almost completed. You have probably guessed what happened. I showed up with the checkbook only to find that all of the homes with quoted prices were much higher than documented on the plans provided to my wife. The one we really wanted was about $70,000 more. The other home already built was about 40,000 dollars more than documented on the plans.We left and will not return. The neighborhood looks great and maybe our experience is some kind of odd anomaly. Just wanted to share it. Good luck.

name: Anthony Shipp
text:
Just had a house built by them, The build to approximately one year due to weather restrictions. But that is not what this is about. The outside of the house is nice and for the most part the inside is ok.

However there are issues with the house that need to be addressed and my mother who has been handling the build for me since I can not be present can not get a hold of anyone. No call backs and no email back.

We are almost certain the HVAC is not connected in the office, the ladder into the attic is not painted or spackled so it is just bare wood, my mother had to paint the trim around the fireplace, and there is a window that still hasn't been installed. The back yard landscaping is terrible, there are so many ruts and holes in the grass that you can barely walk without something to hold onto. The front yard isn't much better.

I could understand a production builder but I would not have expected this from a company that supposed to be a premium builder. The attention to detail is lacking. An expensive production builder.

Update: 28 Jan 2020

Attic stairs still not finished and also realized that the bottom piece of molding is missing from master bathroom window. Also adjacent lots sold to another builder possibly bringing down the property value in existing homes.

I would never recommend building with Woodland and definitely will not consider if I have another home built in the future.

resp.text:
Thank you for your response. We have been in consistent contact with your mom through-out this process. We apologize that communication has been difficult with you since you have been out of country. This is the first we have heard of the HVAC problem, but we have now reported it our warranty department.
It is also not uncommon for a brand new yard of sod to have slight dips after being freshly installed. We are confident that your yard meets warranty guidelines, however, when you return and visit your home we will be happy to look it over again.
Lastly, our records indicate multiple email & phone traffic between the designated POC & the Woodland Homes team.
*Woodland homes appreciates all custom feedback. We are committed to offering a quality home with a one-year warranty in which all terms and conditions are clearly laid out at time of purchase*

name: James Ashbaugh
text: Woodland Homes has made our new home buying experience so seamless, personal, and enjoyable. Thanks to Shanye, John, Rayford, and the whole Woodland Team for all they’ve done to make this transition so great!

name: Tim F
text:
Been in the house as the original owner 6 years, have had multiple issues due to poor subcontractor work.  When a general contractor (Woodland) consistently picks poor subs and refuses to stand behind them, it makes me wonder how they can stay in business as long as they have.

We’ve had plumbing issues with the shower fixtures, roof leaks around the fireplace, and electrical issues with outlets that came loose from the wall.

The most recent is a completely preventable HVAC issue.  The coil sprung a leak after 6 years.  The sub neglected to register the unit, so instead of a 10 year warranty, the manufacturer only gives a five year warranty.  The bill is $2,000 thanks to the sub’s laziness.

Corners were cut at every turn leaving me to wonder what will fail next.  Very disappointed with Woodland, their choice of subs, and lack of accountability.  👎🏻

name: Kim Skaff
text:
Woodland Homes builds a beautiful home on the outside.  However, if you are looking for top quality and attention to detail, you would be better off with another builder. They build homes quickly - maybe too quickly as evidenced by some of the problems we have experienced.  After living in our home for two years, a light switch in our dining room which was not in use at the time suddenly sparked and popped and caused a breaker to blow.  I called an electrician who discovered that the wiring was barely connected which caused arcing and sparking.  He then checked a few more light switches and outlets to find that about half of them were loose and sloppily constructed.  I ended up paying for the electrician to inspect every light switch and electrical plug in my home. I have also had to replace wiring in the electrical box because of a humming noise.
When you build a home with Woodland, they schedule you for a one day marathon of dealing with the contract staff and their design team.  You must be prepared to make ALL decisions in one day.  Their design center has a limited number of choices and you have no time to research products. Don't assume that they offer quality products, either.  Price Pfister products were their plumbing choice at the time I built my home. Huge mistake.  If I had known how crappy this brand was, I would have insisted on Delta products. That goes for wood floors also.  I chose a "premium" product for an additional cost only to find after it started denting and scratching immediately that it was made out of a soft eucalyptus based engineered wood.  I have already replaced half of it with a nice Hickory engineered wood that has held up beautifully- even in high traffic.
I was not happy with either their ceramic tile selection or carpet choices but had no option other than to pick what I disliked the least.  Apparently, most of my neighbors did the same because we all have the same back splash.  I have already replaced carpeting in my bedroom because of poor wear.
This is not the first home that I have had built so it is not like I was expecting perfection.  However, it was expecting better quality than I received.

text: Your worker out on the road was driving like an idiot! He was behind me at a stop sign and decided he was going to make the left hand turn at the same time as me and I almost hit him! Then he speeds down Capshaw passing cars in the turning lane.

name: Brandi Burns
text:
BUYER BEWARE!!!! After your one year warranty do not expect them to help out. After being in our house for 2 1/2 years my floors are pulling apart (all of the down stairs I can put quarters between the cracks), I have a leak around my chimney(all the silicone is cracked), our HOA is now going to be responsible for a 400K loan which was used to build a pool and clubhouse (sold as part of the amenity package), the back half of the neighborhood is now front entry garage all because Woodland can and will do these things to make a buck and does not care once you have purchased the house.

After speaking with someone at Woodland about the leak in my Chimney I was told to contact the people they use to install these but Woodland would not pay for it. At this I asked why and was told "if we fix yours and word gets out we will have to fix everyone's". I now have damage in one bedroom and all my insulation is wet.

As for the floors the only response I get is Wolde put those in and from Wolde I get Woodland rushes us to put them in before they can acclimate to the house. What a run around and hassle you do not want to deal with.

name: Gloria Ross
text: We did refer some friends and now they are building a house with you in. I think that says something about our experience with Woodland Homes of Huntsville.

text: Love the Olde Cobblestone subdivision by Covington and Company located off of Segers Road and Hardiman Road in the Madison area. The homes in Old Cobblestone have historic style architecture with beautiful interior features and amenities.

name: kevin oliver
text: Currently own a Stoneridge built home.  Love the house and neighborhood.  But, when building other homes on the surrounding lots, one of their sub-contractors backed into my mailbox destroying the box and post.  I did not see this happen directly, but the 20+ work trucks parked in front and around my house that day it was a given on where the impact and paint transfer was on the mailbox.  It happened between 5 and 7 PM, so likely a worker high tailing it out for the day.  Rather than accept responsibility for actions of their hired sub-contractors, Stoneridge simply states that they can’t do anything about the damage.  While probably only $100 of damage, Stoneridge’s professionalism and integrity seem to be lacking in this situation.

name: Ashley Rosenberg
text: We attempted to buy a home in Shields Park over a couple of months. It was THE MOST FRUSTRATING EXPERIENCE . The model home representative Ms. Jeannie is extremely polite, professional and hard working but it begins and ends with her. In my opinion, the company seems lacking in organization, desire to accommodate buyers, and interest in helping you make your home personalized to fit your needs.  We were very disappointed. If its THAT BAD before you even buy a house I can only imagine what it's like afterwards.  After reading some of the reviews here maybe we lucked out when they changed the final price on us and we declined?

text: Noce floor plans, home present well... some employees are snobbish some arent. If your not in your Sunday best expect some of them to be cold as ice.

text: My wife and I built a Stoneridge Home in 2017.  Our home is located in Midtowne and we love it. The build quality is great and we live in a great neighborhood . We loved the whole process. They made it easy. From the design center to closing was a seamless process. Great experience.

resp.text: Thank you for the update Steve! We are happy to hear that you and your wife have enjoyed your Stoneridge Home!

name: Nafisa Karim
text:
We have recently built home with the Stoneridge Homes and are extremely satisfied with our choice of builder. We would like to thank all the members of the Stoneridge Homes. However, we want to give our special thanks to Ms. Kim Wright, Ms. Angie Griffin and Mr. Van Wales.
Our home is the first painted brick house in the Moore's Creek subdivision and Ms. Wright designed it which is really awesome. Whenever if we had any issues she listened to us patiently and resolved them.
Ms. Angie Griffin is the most amazing person in the team and she consistently help us throughout the construction process. Our friends who bought Stonebridge home have the same opinion about her. We think she an asset for the Stoneridge Homes Inc.
Although we met Mr. Van Wales at the very end of the process, he explained some of the matters related to the structure of the house very clearly and professionally.
We would have no hesitation in recommending Stoneridge Home to anyone as a preferred builder for quality and good value.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We are so glad you had a good experience and enjoyed working with our staff. Thank you for the recommendation! We wish you many happy years in your new home!

name: Mike Hansen
text: I bought a brand new home from them in Nov. 2018.  I found five defects on my property that needed to be repaired that were covered by my first year warranty.  Stonebridge only fixed three of them.   I have bought two new homes before this one and the builders fixed all of the defects within the first year.  The house is nice but do not expect excellent warranty coverage.

name: Max Kirkland
text:
We had issues with the construction manager when building. Three years later, we have issues with the construction crews in the neighborhood and if you complain to Stoneridge you get the same excuse I got 3 years ago. The excuse is we have so many subcontractors we can't really address the problem specifically. I bet these subcontractors don't work for free, so how do you know to pay them?
Continue to have issues with the construction crews. Nothing is done about them.

name: Chris Buckley
text: Decent value if you can survive the construction gauntlet.   Stoneridge Homes Inc. has some really good looking homes.  The issue is with service.   I know this isn't pleasant to read if you are interested in building with them.  Don't take my word for it, ask others that have built with them.  Our neighborhood commiserated about Stoneridge often.  Our build was  so bad that for accountability we had to take still imagery of every product delivery and every day's progress (as best we could) and it helped us when we had disputes.  Sometimes it takes catching them in a lie or a breach to get movement.  Another tip: save all email correspondence.  In fact, do your best to work with them via email and not in person or by phone.  Or at least have a follow up email about a conversation and make them acknowledge and concur.   We experienced significant issues the entire way from design to closing and after.   I would not recommend building with Stoneridge, but I would recommend taking a look at an inventory or pre-owned home and hiring a meticulous inspector.

name: Tim Donn
text:
In my opinion I would avoid this company at all costs. I was in the process of buying one of their new homes at 7104 Ridgecrest in the Little Mountain development in Owens Cross Roads. All of my opinions are based on this one home, the only Stoneridge home i have been, or ever will be involved with.
The one thing Stoneridge does do good is build a pretty home, interior trim work is beautiful. But in MY OPINION the problems lie beneath.
Their treatment of me as a possible customer is deplorable, that is my opinion. Their customer service towards me was to try to intimidate me with their money and lawyers, instead of even corresponding in a civil manner. When i refused to comply with their wish to keep my earnest money they responded with threats and intimidation.
Instead of providing answers to the questions about the problems with this home in writing, as the contract said and i requested, they delayed the response beyond the 10 Day inspection clause. There were verbals "Don't worry its a new home and we will take care of it" but nothing in writing as i requested. So i would suggest you get everything in writing from all builders, including Stoneridge.
So i posted a bad review on their facebook page, and they removed reviews from their facebook page. So i posted this review and the owners of the company Jim Wright and his Wife called me at home and threatened to "Bury me under a mountain of lawyers" if i did not remove this review. Well now i have a letter from their lawyers threatening to sue me if i do not remove all written libelous remark, etc. etc.

On to the problem:
I had the home inspected and several issues were found. The Master bedroom had a "Soft Spot" in the floor. There were "settling cracks" in the wall board in the entrance to the house. And numerous settling cracks in the entrance porch slab floor, the driveway and the back patio.
In the crawl space there were many pieces of insulation that had fallen from the space in the floor joists. There own construction manager told me the insulation contractor must have forgot the wires used to hold the insulation up. There were missing grates in the ventilation holes in the crawl spaces. On one of the piers the floor joist was not resting on it as it should, probably causing the soft spot. Another pier was damaged.

The big one was the inspector stated "Client is advised to ask the builder if proper footing was built". This was due to the excessive mortar cracking on the rear porch. So i asked, and the question was not ever answered by Stoneridge. However on November 8 a structural engineer (Hired by Stoneridge) inspected the house and suggested "Underpinning" the porch to prohibit further settling. In the dictionary "underpinning" is defined as a fix for a faulty foundation. So there you go, someone else has stated the foundation is faulty or not adequate.
Unfortunately for me the inspection happened to be after the 10 day inspection period, so i had to accept he proposed fix or forfeit my earnest money. How convenient for Stoneridge.
In my opinion i do not want to purchase a brand new, never lived in house that even needs an inspection by a structural engineer to deem whether or not the foundation is adequate. Much less a house that needs underpinning before it is ever lived in.
They did say they would let me out of the contract if they could keep the money and i could use it for the purchase of another Stoneridge home. But who would possibly want to work with people who use threats as a negotiating technique.
All people reading this should look up the definition of Underpinning, and decide for yourself if you should purchase a home from this company. As well look at the 4 complaints to the BBB and see how they respond to defective workmanship complaints.

Of course all of this is my opinion

text: On June 27th I had a very bad experience with a seller by the name of Jeffery in the Springville/Odenville office. Jeffery was very professional up until I realized they false advertised the 0 down and the monthly payments (which was HIM calculating & tell me what I could pay). I was about to pay for the hold of a property that I loved but none of the paperwork benefited nor helped me (ONLY LGI). So after I backed out and finally said “no” to everything and stated that I’m a first time buyer and would need a lawyer present.  Jeffery went on to tell me that no other buyers needed a lawyer, that he was representing me (So not true), & that I would never get a home anyway because of my 606 fico score at the time. He got so rude and loud I literally was in fear for me life. He through my check at me and now no one is answering in the office(which his co worker Mark Witnessed). These homes could be easy to get but believe me there is something to the LGI homes communities. I would not recommend dealing with Jeffery at all he truly showed me he’s a con artist. It wanted to purchase read your paper work, don’t let them fast talk you, and please go with your first mind and do whatever you’re comfortable with.

text:
Home designs are very nice.  The neighborhood is rather boring with the same 3 colors on all the homes.  However, to contradict myself, it allows for the neighborhood to feel more calm and peaceful.  The people in this neighborhood are AMAZING!  The most down to earth, moral and kind community I've ever come across.

If you're looking for a new home, consider this neighborhood.  The construction standards are no better and no worse than anywhere else locally because it is the same construction companies building everywhere.  The problems are minimal and the home warranty company covers everything just about.

With these gorgeous views, excellent location and fantastic neighbors, you'd be missing an opportunity if you didn't buy here.
